distribution.text: Copyright 2024 SUSE LLC. All rights reserved.

notes.text:
This update for openssh fixes the following issues:

- CVE-2023-38408: Fixed a condition where specific libaries loaded via
  ssh-agent(1)'s PKCS#11 support could be abused to achieve remote code
  execution via a forwarded agent socket if those libraries were present on the
  victim's system and if the agent was forwarded to an attacker-controlled
  system. [bsc#1213504, CVE-2023-38408]
notes.title: Description of the patch

notes.title: Terms of use

notes.text: The PKCS#11 feature in ssh-agent in OpenSSH before 9.3p2 has an insufficiently trustworthy search path, leading to remote code execution if an agent is forwarded to an attacker-controlled system. (Code in /usr/lib is not necessarily safe for loading into ssh-agent.) NOTE: this issue exists because of an incomplete fix for CVE-2016-10009.
notes.title: Vulnerability description
